issue.title: Remove support for metadata in doc-comments

repository.name: PHP-CS-Fixer
repository.description: A tool to automatically fix PHP Coding Standards issues

issue.title: The library doesn't work with PHPUnit 12

repository.name: deprecations
repository.description: Thin library around different deprecation strategies

issue.body:
As of PHPUnit 12 (https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5541) doc-block annotations are not supported.

The library uses them in the following places: https://github.com/doctrine/deprecations/blob/738eb98a38a5897b48e44df7edc95f4fc705afee/src/PHPUnit/VerifyDeprecations.php#L29-L30 https://github.com/doctrine/deprecations/blob/738eb98a38a5897b48e44df7edc95f4fc705afee/src/PHPUnit/VerifyDeprecations.php#L35-L36

issue.title: dataProvider seems ignored in PHPUnit 12.1.3
issue.body:
Hi, 
passing from _PHP7.4.33+PHPUnit 9.6.18_ to **PHP 8.3.21RC1+PHPUnit 12.1.3**, dataProvider seems ignored during test.
The test is very simple:
```php
declare(strict_types=1);
require_once __DIR__ . '/../../vendor/autoload.php';

use PHPUnit\Framework\Attributes\DataProvider;
use PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase;

use Dbmi\Webservice\Analysis\Intensity;

class IntensityTest extends TestCase{

        public static function dataProvider(){
                return [
                        ['0',           0],
                        ['1',           1],
                        ['D',           6.4],
                        ['HD',          8.6]
                ];
        }
        
        /** 
         * @dataProvider dataProvider
         */
        public function testIntensity(string $value, float $expected): void{
                $obj = new Intensity($value);
                $this->assertEquals($obj->value(), $expected);
        }               
}
```

and the return error (in bold) is that testIntensity() method is not executed because dataProvider dont provide data: 

> PHPUnit Started (PHPUnit 12.1.3 using PHP 8.3.21RC1 (cli) on Linux)
> Test Runner Configured
> Bootstrap Finished (/project/vendor/autoload.php)
> Event Facade Sealed
> Test Suite Loaded (1 test)
> Static Analysis for Code Coverage Started
> Static Analysis for Code Coverage Finished (11 cache hits, 0 cache misses)
> Test Runner Started
> Test Suite Sorted
> Test Runner Execution Started (1 test)
> Test Suite Started (IntensityTest, 1 test)
> Test Preparation Started (IntensityTest::testIntensity)
> Test Prepared (IntensityTest::testIntensity)
> Test Errored (IntensityTest::testIntensity)
> **Too few arguments to function IntensityTest::testIntensity(), 0 passed in /project/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestCase.php on line 1260 and exactly 2 expected**
> Test Finished (IntensityTest::testIntensity)
> Test Suite Finished (IntensityTest, 1 test)
> Test Runner Execution Finished
> Test Runner Finished

it runs in the environment generated by this docker file:
```
FROM php:8.3-rc-cli-alpine
RUN apk add --update linux-headers git $PHPIZE_DEPS \
        && pecl install xdebug \
        && docker-php-ext-enable xdebug

RUN echo "xdebug.start_with_request=yes" >> /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/xdebug.ini \
    && echo "xdebug.mode=coverage" >> /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/xdebug.ini \
    && echo "xdebug.discover_client_host=1" >> /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/xdebug.ini \
    && echo "xdebug.client_port=9000" >> /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/xdebug.ini

RUN mv "$PHP_INI_DIR/php.ini-production" "$PHP_INI_DIR/php.ini"
RUN perl -p -i -e "s/memory_limit = 128M/memory_limit = 1024M/" "$PHP_INI_DIR/php.ini"
RUN php -r "readfile('http://getcomposer.org/installer');" | php -- --install-dir=/usr/bin/ --filename=composer --disable-iconv
RUN alias composer='php /usr/bin/composer'
```

The entire code is clonable by: https://packagist.org/packages/dbmi/webservice-library#2.0.4
(in the next version 2.0.5 i just change the test to avoid dataprovider and let the test pass)
